channel.title: CyberNetSec - Phishing
channel.description: Latest phishing threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Massive AT&T Customer Dataset with 148M SSNs Resurfaces in Criminal Circles
item.description:
A massive and highly sensitive dataset allegedly containing the personal information of AT&T customers has resurfaced and is being circulated in criminal forums. The data trove reportedly includes approximately 176 million records, featuring over 133 million full names and addresses, and, most criti...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: LinkedIn Phishing Campaign Targets Executives Using Legitimate Pen-Testing Tools
item.description:
A new phishing campaign discovered by ReliaQuest is abusing LinkedIn's private messaging feature to target executives and IT professionals. The attackers use social engineering to trick victims into downloading and running a malicious archive file. The attack's novelty lies in its use of a legitimat...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Fake LINE Messenger Installer Spreads ValleyRAT Malware
item.description:
A malware campaign attributed to the Silver Fox APT group is distributing the ValleyRAT remote access trojan by disguising it as an installer for the popular LINE messaging app. The campaign, which primarily targets Chinese-speaking users, uses the trojanized software as a lure to infect systems. On...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sophisticated Phishing Attack Uses PDF Lures and Cloud Services to Steal Dropbox Credentials
item.description:
A new, multi-stage phishing campaign is using procurement-themed emails with benign-looking PDF attachments to bypass email security filters. The attack chain redirects victims through a legitimate cloud service, Vercel Blob, before presenting a convincing fake Dropbox login page. The goal is to har...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Warning: Malicious ChatGPT Chrome Extensions Steal Session Tokens to Hijack Accounts
item.description:
Researchers have identified 16 malicious Google Chrome extensions that masquerade as helpful tools for OpenAI's ChatGPT. Once installed, these extensions inject malicious scripts into the ChatGPT web application. The scripts are designed to monitor outbound requests, intercept sensitive data such as...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: New Iran-Linked 'RedKitten' Group Targets Human Rights NGOs with AI-Suspected Malware
item.description:
A new cyber-espionage campaign by a Farsi-speaking threat actor dubbed 'RedKitten' is targeting human rights NGOs and activists documenting abuses in Iran. The campaign, observed by HarfangLab in January 2026, uses phishing emails with macro-laced Excel files as an initial vector. The malware is not...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Novel Phishing Attack Abuses Vercel and Telegram to Deliver RATs
item.description:
A novel phishing campaign, observed between November 2025 and January 2026, is abusing trusted `*.vercel.app` domains to bypass email security filters and deliver malware. The attack, detailed by Cloudflare, uses financial lures like fake invoices to trick victims into clicking. A unique feature is ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Global Phishing Campaign Lures Victims with Fake Job Offers
item.description:
A multi-lingual phishing campaign is targeting job seekers across the United States, United Kingdom, France, Italy, and Spain. According to research from Bitdefender, attackers are impersonating well-known employers and staffing companies, sending emails with fake job offers that promise easy work a...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 1-Click RCE Flaw in IDIS Cloud Manager Puts Users at Risk
item.description:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-12556, has been discovered in the IDIS Cloud Manager (ICM) viewer by researchers at Claroty's Team82. The flaw, which has a CVSS v4 score of 8.7, allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a user's machine by convincing them to clic...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Phishing, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socia...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach, Threat Actor
